alert.note: Alert for Walker; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 1:23AM CST until December 11 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Grimes, Montgomery, Walker and Waller. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Conroe, Navasota, Montgomery, Anderson, Todd Mission, Lake Conroe Dam, Dacus, Dobbin, Plantersville and Richards. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
